intro: Eremogone kingii var. rosea, commonly known as the pink sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Eremogone kingii var. rosea is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
